name: You can apply for a conditional / final order JOINT SOLICITOR
body:
Case number: ((reference number))
Applicant 1: ((applicant name))
Applicant 2: ((respondent name))
Issue date: ((date of issue))
Your reference: ((solicitor reference))

Dear ((solicitor name))

You can now apply for a ((isConditionalOrder??conditional))((isFinalOrder??final)) order on this ((isDivorce??divorce))((isDissolution??dissolution)) application. Both parties need to apply because this is a joint application. The other party has also been sent this email.

Apply for a ((isConditionalOrder??conditional))((isFinalOrder??final)) order: ((signin url))

If you want to change to a sole application then it will delay the divorce application. You will have to make a separate application by downloading and filling out a D84 paper form. Details of where to send it are on the form.You should exit the service and send in the form if you want to change to a sole application.

Divorce and Dissolution
HM Courts & Tribunals Service
divorcecase@justice.gov.uk
0300 303 0642 (Monday to Friday, 8am to 6pm)

Your feedback helps improve this service for others: https://www.smartsurvey.co.uk/s/Divorce_Feedback/?pageurl=/email
subject: Apply for a ((isConditionalOrder??conditional))((isFinalOrder??final)) order: ((reference number))
